page.title: 07Churches in Upton on Severn
page.content: There are three denominations in Upton on Severn, by 1820 the old church near the river was in disarepair, plans were drawn up for a church on the same site but decided against. Mr. Martin of Ham Court gave the site of the present{Anglican {church}built in 1879. Today the old church is restored and contains the tourist office. St.Josephs{catholic church}was built in 1849 and had a resident priest until the present time.It is now served from Hanley Swan. The{Baptist {church} may have started in a house in Dunns Lane,later the community built the present church in Old Street. In 1891 a new chapel in New Street only lasted 20 years and is now a garage.
